6.17.24  7:44 am   when you are songwriting, do you ever feel as if certain elements of the song you are creating (such as rhythm, chord progression, and/or lyrics) are too similar to a previous song you have already written, or that what you are writing lacks novelty?

     if so, how do you overcome this issue?
6.17.24  3:11 am   how in the world do you come up with your lyrics?

6.17.24  1:53 am   I hate the producer hell moments I get into with my stuff, where I finish a master, thinking finally it's good to go, and then hear it a bit later and know there's something I have to adjust, I adjust it, I export it, and repeat. The finickiness of it stinks. Eventually you hear something you might want to adjust and just call it done anyway because it's close enough. I'd take it over not finishing something but that part is always an annoying end to making each song. Do you ever have this? I wonder if the digital age is partially to blame, where you can adjust every little thing at any moment in any way
